title: Hunt for driver who stabbed man multiple times in road rage attack in south-west Sydney
text:
Confronting footage has captured the shocking moment a man was stabbed up to 11 times in his car in a violent rage rage attack.

The manhunt for his attacker armed with a knife is underway after he fled the scene following the incident in Sydney's south-west early Monday morning.

Security camera footage captured the dramatic moment two cars collided in Wyattville Drive, West Hoxton just before 1am.

One driver is seen wielding a knife then got out of his car to confront the other driver.

He is captured lunging at the man through the car window, punching and stabbing the victim up to 11 times.

Security cameras capture the moment a man gets out of his car to confront the other driver

The attacker is then captured driving off as the injured man limps to a nearby home to call for help.

When emergency services arrived at the scene, the injured man, 25, was found with multiple stab wounds.

A NSW Ambulance spokesman told Daily Mail Australia the man suffered stab wounds to his chest and arms.

The man lunges through the car window to stab and punch the other driver up to 11 times

The injured man was treated at the scene by paramedics before he was taken to Liverpool Hospital, where he remains in a serious but stable condition.

A crime scene was established by Liverpool Police and an investigation into the circumstances surrounding the incident is underway.

The crash occurred near the intersection of Vlatko Road.

Anyone with information is urged to call Crime Stoppers on 1800 333 000.

The man gets back into the car and flees the scene while the injured man limps off to get help
description: Confronting footage has captured the shocking moment a man was stabbed up to 11 times in his car in a violent rage rage attack in Sydney's south-west.
authors: Kylie Stevens For Daily Mail Australia
